bibl.title: [Letter] 1839 Dec. 3, Bolivar, Tennessee [to] James King, Murfreesboro, Tennessee / Austin Miller
bibl.author: Miller, Austin
bibl.note: This is a very brief letter dated December 3, 1839 from Austin Miller to James Moore King. Miller informs King of the legal steps he had taken toward settlement of a debt.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 3.0 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.opener:
18 James M. King Esq. Murfreesboro Tennessee Bolivar Te. Dec 4
Bolivar T. December 3rd 1839. James M King Esq
div1.p: Sometime last year Mr More placd in my hands for collection a note on Jnuss Hineman for about five hundred dollars I brought suit agat Hineman in the circuit court of Mehainy & obtained judgment- he removed to Lincoln County I have had the execution sent after him I this evening recd a letter states stating that the sheriff has levied the execution on a tract of land in Lincoln cty containing 118 acres which the shff thinks is worth five or ten hundred dollars but believes it will not sell for much unless you had an agent their to bid it off- The sale will take place on the 14 this month- Had you willin send out some person to see to it or go go yourself, I think if you were to attend the sale your debt might be made- Hineman carried off a negroe boy from Mcraig about 13 years of age. I write in hast as the mail is about closing
